text: at the city of Johns Creek I'm the chief
data officer so one of the key things
that we've been working on at the city
is open data and that's for transparency
and accessibility information and so AWS
specifically has helped us get our data
out into more hands we launched our
alexis skill in the spring of 2018 and
over the first few months that we had at
launch we noticed that on average we're
saving about 10 hours of staff time
answering kind of basic level questions
that the citizens can now just ask Alexa
the Alexa skill that we built on AWS has
helped us democratize data in a way that
we weren't able to before we had and we
still do have an open data site which is
you know very heavily used but it
doesn't reach everybody and having the
skill puts all that data at some of
these fingertips that wouldn't normally
go to a site like an open to open data
portal would with our alexis skill our
citizens are able to ask things like
what's the zoning of a specific property
they're able to ask about current job
openings at the city they're also able
to find things like what's on the
calendar or when's the next council
meeting there's over 200 different
questions that the citizens can ask our
skill that are all powered by our open
data site and Alexa we're also looking
at using some of the service credits
that we were awarded to potentially have
hackathons or other kinds of community
engagement events that bring in people
experts from outside of the city to
bring new ideas fresh ideas of ways that
we can take open data and all the great
tools that are on AWS and kind of create
something new that we either enhance the
skill or or take us in a completely
different direction
[Music]
